title: England vs Hungary live stream: how to watch World Cup 2022 qualifier from anywhere now
author: kevin-lynch
summary: Southgate's men could all but seal their place at Qatar 2022
article: A win for the Three Lions at Wembley should all but confirm their place at next year's World Cup in Qatar. Read on to find out how to watch England vs Hungary online and get a World Cup 2022 qualifier live stream, regardless of where you are in the world today.
The hosts tonight come up against a wounded Hungarian side fresh from a behind closed doors 0-1 defeat at home to Albania on Saturday that has all but cost them a playoff place.
England are currently sitting pretty at the top of Group I with a four point advantage over second-placed Albania.

Gareth Southgate's men moved a step closer to confirming their place at football's biggest tournament with a 5-0 win away to 156th ranked Andorra on Saturday in a match that saw five separate players get on the scoresheet.

The much-changed England line-up saw Phil Foden impress as the Man City star looked to a stake claim in the regular starting eleven, and it will be interesting to see if Southgate opts to select the 21-year-old for this likely more testing fixture.
Follow our guide to get a England vs Hungary live stream and watch this World Cup 2022 qualifier online from anywhere this weekend.

If you're abroad right now and struggling to tap into your local coverage of the game, you'll want a VPN. This'll help you circumvent the geo-blocking that will try to stop you watching an England vs Hungary live stream in particular parts of the world.
They're a useful means of getting around this issue, are cheap, and easy to set-up as well.
Use a VPN to watch England vs Hungary from anywhere
Using a VPN is as easy as one-two-three...
1. Download and install a VPN - as we say, our top choice is ExpressVPN
2. Connect to the appropriate server location - open the VPN app, hit 'choose location' and select the appropriate location
3. Go to the broadcaster's live stream - so if you're from the UK, just head to the ITV Hub site or app
